title: Refine detail pane information display
description:

title: Add incremental background refresh for real-time updates
description:
Implement background refresh mechanism to keep the Abacus UI synchronized with changes to the beads database without requiring manual restarts.

**Requirements:**
- Poll for changes to `.beads/beads.db` in the background (check file modification time or use file watchers)
- Reload issue data incrementally when changes are detected
- Update the UI smoothly without clearing/redrawing the entire screen
- Preserve user state during refresh:
  - Current cursor position (or select nearest issue if current one was deleted)
  - Expanded/collapsed node states
  - Active search filter
  - Detail panel state and scroll position
  - Current focus area
- Add subtle indicator when refresh occurs (e.g., brief status message)
- Configurable refresh interval (default: 2-5 seconds)
- Optional: Add manual refresh keybinding (e.g., 'r' key)

**Technical Approach:**
- Use BubbleTea `tea.Tick` or `tea.Every` for periodic checks
- Implement smart diff to detect what changed (new issues, updates, deletions)
- Merge changes into existing model without full rebuild
- Maintain visual stability by preserving tree structure where possible

**User Experience Goals:**
- Changes appear naturally without disrupting workflow
- No jarring screen flashes or resets
- User can continue navigating while refresh happens
- Transparent operation - "it just works"

title: Add ability to edit issue status from TUI
description:
Add interactive functionality to change issue status directly from the Abacus TUI without needing to exit to the command line.

**Features:**
- Keyboard shortcut to enter status edit mode (e.g., 's' for status)
- Show current status of selected issue
- Display menu/picker with available statuses:
  - open
  - in_progress
  - blocked
  - closed
- Arrow keys or vim keys (j/k) to select status
- Enter to confirm, Esc to cancel
- Update issue via `bd update <id> --status=<new-status>` command
- Refresh UI immediately after status change
- Show visual feedback (success message or brief indicator)
- Update icon and colors to reflect new status

**Nice-to-haves:**
- Quick status toggle shortcuts (e.g., 'i' for in_progress, 'c' for closed)
- Validation to prevent invalid state transitions
- Confirmation prompt when closing issues
- Show reason field when closing (integrate with `bd close` command)

**Integration:**
- Should work seamlessly with incremental refresh feature (ab-176) if implemented
- Update tree view to reflect new status immediately
- Preserve cursor position and other UI state

title: Retry comments after fetch errors
description: fetchCommentsForNode sets CommentsLoaded even when the bd comments command or JSON decoding fails, so transient errors permanently hide comments until restart. Only mark the node as loaded after a successful fetch or store the error for later retries.

title: Add ability to search issues by bead ID
description:
Enhance the search functionality to support searching by bead ID in addition to the current title-based search.

**Current Behavior:**
- Search (/) only filters by issue title
- No way to quickly jump to a specific bead by ID

**Desired Behavior:**
- Search should match against both issue title AND issue ID
- Searching for "ab-4aw" should immediately filter to show only that bead
- Partial ID matches should work (e.g., "4aw" finds "ab-4aw")
- Case-insensitive matching
- Show all matching issues if multiple beads match the search

**Implementation:**
- Update the `matches` function in `recalcVisibleRows()` (main.go:510-515)
- Check if filterText matches issue ID in addition to title
- Consider matching with or without the prefix (e.g., both "ab-4aw" and "4aw")

**User Experience:**
- Existing search behavior for titles remains unchanged
- ID search provides fast navigation to specific issues
- Filter indicator shows search term as usual
- Clear with Esc as normal

**Testing:**
- Verify full ID search (e.g., "ab-4aw")
- Verify partial ID search (e.g., "4aw")
- Verify case-insensitive matching
- Verify title search still works
- Verify combined results when search matches multiple issues

title: Add ability to add comments to issues from TUI
description:
Add interactive functionality to create comments on issues directly from the Abacus TUI, enabling collaboration and note-taking without leaving the interface.

**Features:**
- Keyboard shortcut to enter comment mode (e.g., 'c' or 'C' for comment)
- Multi-line text input for comment body
- Support markdown formatting in comments
- Show preview of rendered markdown before submitting
- Save comment via `bd comments <id> add "<text>"` command
- Refresh detail pane to show new comment immediately
- Display visual feedback on success/failure

**UI/UX Design:**
- Use a modal or overlay for comment input
- Text area with word wrap
- Show character/line count (optional)
- Keyboard shortcuts:
  - Ctrl+Enter or Ctrl+S to submit
  - Esc to cancel
  - Tab to toggle preview mode (optional)
- Author auto-detected from git config or system username
- Timestamp automatically added by Beads

**Technical Integration:**
- Use BubbleTea textarea component from bubbles library
- Integrate with `bd comments` command
- Reload comments for current issue after adding
- Update viewport content to show new comment
- Preserve scroll position in detail pane

**Nice-to-haves:**
- Markdown syntax highlighting in input
- @mention support for assignees
- Quote/reply to existing comments
- Edit/delete existing comments
- Comment templates for common responses

title: Prevent cursor panic after filtering
description: Recalculate cursor bounds after filtering or expand/collapse operations. Currently, when the visible rows shrink (e.g., applying a filter at the bottom of the list), handlers still index m.visibleRows[m.cursor], triggering an index-out-of-range panic.

title: Clamp viewport dimensions
description: Window resize handling can assign negative widths/heights to the viewport (int(width*0.45)-2) and to the tree pane, which can panic inside lipgloss/viewport in narrow terminals. Clamp dimensions to sensible minimums before rendering.

title: Research Beads repository structure and CI/CD setup
description:
Investigate how the Beads CLI repository is structured to replicate best practices for Abacus:

**Areas to research:**
- CI/CD configuration (GitHub Actions workflows)
- Release process and automation
- Binary building and distribution
- Repository metadata and documentation structure
- Testing setup and coverage
- Linting and code quality tools
- Issue/PR templates
- Contributing guidelines
- Code of conduct
- Security policy

**Repository:** https://github.com/beadscli/beads

**Deliverable:** Document findings and create a checklist of items to implement for Abacus that align with Beads' approach.

title: Define requirements for automatic refresh
description:
Define how abacus should handle automatic refresh of beads data:
- Auto-refresh when .beads/ database file changes (file watcher)
- Manual refresh with keyboard shortcut (e.g., 'r' key)
- Preserve current cursor position and expanded state after refresh
- Show loading indicator during refresh
- Handle errors gracefully (e.g., if bd command fails)
- Consider refresh interval options (disabled, 1s, 5s, 10s, etc.)
- Maintain filter/search state across refreshes

title: Test multi-level hierarchy display
description: Create test issues to verify that the tree view correctly displays multiple levels of parent-child relationships and handles deep nesting gracefully.

title: Use display width for tree wrapping
description: wrapWithHangingIndent uses len() on strings that already include multi-byte glyphs and ANSI styling, leading to incorrect continuation indents for the tree view. Use lipgloss.Width on the rendered prefix instead of byte length to keep wraps aligned.

title: Add automated tests
description: Introduce Go unit tests for helper functions (wrapping, indenting, stats) to prevent regressions now that the detail pane logic is more complex.

title: Surface bd show failures
description: batchFetchIssues ignores errors from bd show or JSON parsing, which causes silently missing beads in the UI. The loader should return an error with context when fetching or decoding a chunk fails.
